events.body: Should the `contrib/verify-commits/trusted-git-root` be updated as well?
verified that the key `133EAC179436F14A5CF1B794860FEB804E669320` is indeed the one I have in my keyring

> Should the `contrib/verify-commits/trusted-git-root` be updated as well?

I don't think so. @sipa's last merge predates the current trusted-git-root by more than a year.

> Should the contrib/verify-commits/trusted-git-root be updated as well?

Let's see if the checks still pass.

ACK 8cbeab4d90437765d1e63b95ede81e4d5e7c975f

The key removed is the same as the one in my keyring.

 > Let's see if the checks still pass.

We don't do verify-commits for PRs, so CI won't help here.

I've run verify-commits locally with the key removed and the current trusted-git-root and there were no issues.

ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25568/commits/8cbeab4d90437765d1e63b95ede81e4d5e7c975f

Verified the fingerprint from https://bitcoincore.org/en/contact/

Thank you for being a bitcoin core maintainer since May 2011. I have learn a lot of things reading your posts and will keep learning as you will still be active as a contributor.

An OP_RETURN tx for memories: https://mempool.space/tx/830e6cb9ae8a35efa23c1053db942db8abe7d3f362f6173638860ee7849507ae

ACK 8cbeab4d90437765d1e63b95ede81e4d5e7c975f

Thanks for everything @sipa and good luck on your future endeavors.

ACK 8cbeab4d90437765d1e63b95ede81e4d5e7c975f

Verified fingerprint matches the key in my keyring.

Thank you @sipa for all your work on core, and invaluable responses on bitcoin.stackexchange. 

Best of wishes on your next chapter!
